罰.definition: to punish; to penalize; to fine

罰不當罪.definition: disproportionate punishment; the punishment is harsher than the crime

罰出場.definition: (of a referee) to send a player off the field

罰半蹲.definition: to punish a student by having him stand in a half-squatting position with arms extended forward

罰寫.definition: to make a student write sth out many times, as a punishment; writing lines

罰沒.definition: to impose a fine and confiscate (property)

罰站.definition: to be made to stand still as a punishment

罰酒.definition: to drink as the result of having lost a bet
